content.title: HFrEF Treatment (Guideline-Directed Medical Therapy)
content.summary: Evidence-based pharmacotherapy for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
key_points: Four pillars: ARNI/ACEi + Beta-blocker + MRA + SGLT2i
Quadruple therapy reduces mortality ~75% vs placebo
Initiate all four drug classes early, titrate to target doses
Ivabradine if HR >70 despite max beta-blocker
ICD if EF ≤35% after 3 months GDMT

statement.text: HFrEF treatment consists of four foundational drug classes (ARNI or ACEi, beta-blocker, MRA, SGLT2i) that reduce mortality and hospitalizations. All four should be initiated early and titrated to target doses. Device therapy (ICD, CRT) is added based on EF and ECG criteria after optimal medical therapy.
statement.formal: HFrEF GDMT = (ARNI or ACEi/ARB) + Beta-blocker + MRA + SGLT2i → Target doses → Consider ICD/CRT

explanation.intuition: HFrEF treatment counteracts the harmful neurohormonal activation (RAAS, sympathetic) that drives disease progression. Each drug class blocks a different harmful pathway - together they're synergistic. Think of it as putting out a fire with multiple extinguishers.
explanation.key_insight: The paradigm has shifted from sequential addition to early initiation of all four classes. Don't wait to 'maximize' one drug before starting another - start all four early at low doses, then uptitrate.
explanation.technical_details: Target doses are evidence-based from landmark trials: enalapril 10-20mg BID (CONSENSUS, SOLVD), carvedilol 25mg BID (COPERNICUS), spironolactone 25-50mg daily (RALES), sacubitril/valsartan 97/103mg BID (PARADIGM-HF), dapagliflozin 10mg daily (DAPA-HF).

definitions_glossary.GDMT: Guideline-directed medical therapy - evidence-based treatments proven to reduce mortality
definitions_glossary.ARB: Angiotensin receptor blocker; alternative to ACEi
definitions_glossary.SGLT2_inhibitor: Sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 inhibitor; benefits HF independent of glucose-lowering
definitions_glossary.beta_blocker: Beta-adrenergic receptor antagonist; reduces sympathetic activation
definitions_glossary.target_dose: Dose proven effective in clinical trials, goal of titration
definitions_glossary.ICD: Implantable cardioverter-defibrillator for sudden death prevention
definitions_glossary.CRT: Cardiac resynchronization therapy for dyssynchrony in LBBB
definitions_glossary.neurohormonal_blockade: Pharmacologic inhibition of RAAS and sympathetic nervous system
definitions_glossary.reverse_remodeling: Improvement in LV size and function with effective therapy

therapeutic_targets.RAAS: ACEi/ARB/ARNI block angiotensin II effects; MRA blocks aldosterone
therapeutic_targets.natriuretic_peptides: ARNI enhances protective natriuretic peptide effects
therapeutic_targets.SGLT2: Multiple mechanisms: diuresis, improved energetics, reduced preload

ARNI.notes: 36-hour washout from ACEi to avoid angioedema

beta_blocker.drugs: Carvedilol, metoprolol succinate, bisoprolol (only these three)
beta_blocker.notes: Start low, uptitrate every 2 weeks; don't start if decompensated

MRA.monitoring: Check potassium and creatinine; avoid if K >5.0 or eGFR <30

SGLT2_inhibitor.notes: Benefits regardless of diabetes status; may have euglycemic DKA risk

ivabradine.indication: HR >70 despite maximum tolerated beta-blocker, sinus rhythm
ivabradine.mechanism: Selective If channel blocker - slows HR without BP effect

diuretics.role: Symptom relief for congestion; no mortality benefit
diuretics.drugs: Furosemide, torsemide, bumetanide (loops); metolazone (add for resistance)

digoxin.role: Symptom improvement, reduced HF hospitalization; no mortality benefit
digoxin.indication: Persistent symptoms despite GDMT; AF rate control

ICD.indication: LVEF ≤35% despite ≥3 months GDMT, NYHA II-III, life expectancy >1 year
ICD.notes: Wait at least 40 days post-MI, 90 days after revascularization

CRT.benefit: Improves symptoms, EF, and survival with LBBB morphology
CRT.CRT_D_vs_CRT_P: CRT-D (with ICD) for most; CRT-P if not ICD candidate

altLabel.@value: Heart Failure with Reduced EF Therapy

definition.@value: Evidence-based pharmacotherapy and device therapy for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction, comprising four foundational drug classes plus ICD/CRT when indicated

medicalCode.description: Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (disorder)

learning_objectives: Name the four foundational drug classes for HFrEF
State target doses for each class
Apply criteria for ICD and CRT
Describe the benefit of early quadruple therapy initiation
clinical_pearls: Start all four drug classes early at low doses rather than maximizing one at a time
Only carvedilol, metoprolol succinate, and bisoprolol have mortality data
36-hour washout between ACEi and ARNI to prevent angioedema
SGLT2i benefits are independent of diabetes - use in all HFrEF
Wait 40 days post-MI and 90 days post-revascularization before ICD

board_yield.usmle_step2: Very High - drug selection, dosing, contraindications
